Title:
Reclassification of Sporobolomyces species of
Agaricostilbomycetes (Pucciniomycotina) using three rDNA gene sequence
analyses: the proposal of Teunia gen. nov. and Pseudosporobolomyces gen.
nov., and description of three novel species
Keywords:
basidiomycetous yeasts; Agaricostilbomycetes;
Sporobolomyces; molecular phylogeny; reclassification.
Abstract:
Sporobolomyces is highly polyphyletic, and disperses in
Agaricostilbomycetes, Cystobasidiomycetes, Microbotryomycetes and
Mixiomycetes of of Pucciniomycotina, but this genus is still not been
revised. 18S rDNA, D1/D2 domain of 28S rDNA and ITS+5.8S rDNA region
were used to reclassify these Sporobolomyces species within
Agaricostilbomycetes in this study. All Sporobolomyces species in this
class were grouped into four clades according to the analyses of the
combined three rDNA genes. Cystobasidiopsis and Ballistosporomyces are
emended to accommodate the Cystobasidiopsis and sasicola clades. Teunia
gen. nov. and Pseudosporobolomyces gen. nov. are proposed as two new
genera to contain the taxa in the ruber and subbrunneus clade. Three new
species were also described here, namely Ballistosporomyces
changbaiensis sp nov., Ballistosporomyces tibetensis sp nov. and
Pseudosporobolomyces taiwanensis sp nov.
